The outbreak of COVID-19 and the change of daily life after hospitalization, together with the uncertainty about the disease progress may lead to anxiety, panic, concern and excessive pessimism in some patients confirmed with COVID-19. Pharmacists should pay full attention to the mental health and emotional management of patients during pharmaceutical care.
28 Timely emotional counselling and psychological support shall be provided to help patients properly understand the COVID-19 and enhance confidence. For mild or moderate patients, pharmacists may encourage them to take adequate exercise (such as dancing) to enhance the immunity and relieve negative emotions. If the patients are considered having severe psychological problem, referral to psychiatrists shall be made. For patients with mental disorders (such as depression and anxiety disorder), pharmacists should pay close attention to their psychotropic medication compliance and assist psychiatrists in providing psychological intervention.
